decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):- RPR/01; RPR/02 REV C; RPR/03 REV C; RPR/04 REV C; RPR/05 REV C; RPR/06 REV C; RPR/07 REV C; RPR/08 REV C; RPR/09 REV C; RPR/10 REV C; RPR/11 REV C; RPR/12 REV C; RPR/13 REV C; 2022-6GA-CON-2 REV 1.0B.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and the Mount Park Conservation Area Management Plan. | Cycle storage as shown in drawing number: RPR/02 REV C; shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently. Cycle parking shall comply with the London Cycling Design Standards.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development and to provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Refuse and recycling storage as shown in drawing number: 2022-6GA-CON-2 REV 1.0B; shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policy SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012).

| The obscure windows up to 1.7m from floor level to the southern elevations of Flat D at ground floor level, the southern elevation of Flat G at first floor level and the northern elevations of Flats E and F at first floor level, as indicated on drawings: RPR/03 REV C; RPR/04 REV C; RPR/09 REV C; and RPR/10 REV C; shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and permanently retained
for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with  policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012). | The rooflights hereby approved shall be a 'conservation rooflight' which lies flat in the roofand does not project beyond the roof plane.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary condition 2 (approved drawings) and condition 5 (refuse and recycling storage) of planning permission ref: 177450FUL dated 16/10/2019 for: Conversion of dwellinghouse into nine self-contained residential units (5x one bed and 4x two bed); single storey side extension, part single, part three storey rear extensions, rear dormer roof extension, installation of rooflights to side and rear roofslopes; associated alterations to the fenestration on all elevations; front boundary treatment and provision of car parking spaces, cycle, refuse/recycling storage and amenity space. Amendment seeks alterations to approved driveway arrangement to provide more parking space; and changes to front landscaping, and location of refuse storage
